title: Coronavirus stimulus bill offers relief for retirees
text: Retirees and pre-retirees considering tapping their qualified retirement accounts to survive tough times just got a tax break. The recently passed $2 trillion stimulus law features loan provisions that are designed for anyone “who experiences adverse financial consequences as a result of being quarantined or being furloughed.

title: Investment professionals say ‘don’t panic’ amid coronavirus fears
text: It’s a wild ride, but just hang on. Investors can survive and eventually prosper despite the horrific pandemic-driven stock market gyrations we are experiencing, investment professionals say.

title: Trump says if he has to put tariffs on oil imports to protect energy workers he will
text: President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would put tariffs on imports of crude oil or take other measures if he has to protect energy workers from the oil price crash.

title: Private Equity Firm Pushes for Broader Access to Fed Lending Program
text: Apollo has led a push to expand a program intended to keep loans flowing to small businesses and households by allowing for more kinds of assets to be offered as collateral.

title: OPEC-Russia meeting delayed until April 9 amid turmoil in energy markets
text: OPEC and Russia have postponed a meeting set for Monday to discuss supply cuts and ending a brutal price war.

title: What To Expect From Bear Market Rallies
text: Many traders and investors are not familiar with what can take place in a bear market as the sharp rallies can often make them alter their strategies. That was the case in the spring of 2008 as many turned bullish just before the decline resumed.

title: New guidance on SBA loans means most startups are still excluded from $349 billion stimulus
text: Under new guidance issued by the Small Business Administration it seems non-profits and faith-based groups can apply for the Paycheck Protection Program loans designed to keep small business afloat during the COVID-19 epidemic, but most venture-backed companies are still not covered. Late Friday night, the Treasury Department updated its rules regarding the “affiliation” of private […]

title: Oil set to 'crater' Monday as OPEC meeting delayed, tensions flare between Saudi Arabia and Russia
text: The meeting between OPEC and its allies scheduled for Monday has been postponed amid ongoing tensions surrounding production cuts.

title: Short High Yield Credit To Hedge Your Stocks Portfolio
text: After another week of volatile trading in the US stock market, shorting high yield credit might be the best way to hedge your portfolio.  We explain why.

title: Trump's Job Losses Will Exceed The Great Recession’s
text: Unfortunately, Friday’s employment drop of 701,000 jobs will look small in comparison to next month’s report. It could easily be over 10 million, which would be greater than the 8.6 million jobs lost during the Great Recession.

title: Trump says will ask Congress for more small business funds if money runs out
text: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would ask Congress for more money to make loans to small businesses struggling with the economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak if the original $349 billion allocated in a fiscal stimulus bill runs out.

title: OPEC+ meeting delayed as Saudi Arabia and Russia row over oil price collapse: sources
text: OPEC and Russia have postponed a meeting due on Monday to discuss oil output cuts until April 9, OPEC sources said on Saturday, as a row between Moscow and Saudi Arabia over who is to blame for plunging crude prices intensified.

title: Bank of America says the lows for stock prices and corporate bonds are in
text: Signs are emerging that the bulk of the selling in stock and corporate bonds is behind us, according to Bank of America's chief investment strategist Michael Hartnett.

title: OPEC Meeting Is Delayed as Saudi and Russian Tensions Flare
text: The meeting, planned for Monday, had buoyed hopes for a quick deal to end the turmoil in oil markets.

title: Wall Street adjusts to working at home: Lost screen real estate, Citi's new 'world headquarters'
text: CNBC spoke with several Wall Street players to see how they are adjusting to the new reality of working from home.

title: Global economy screeches to a halt as coronavirus job losses take toll
text: The shock of the coronavirus is hitting the economy like another Great Depression — and Americans aren’t alone in their misery. A tsunami of job losses and welfare claims in Britain, the European Union and Asia in the last two weeks parallel the 10 million unemployment claims in the US as businesses around the world.

title: Crisis On Wall Street: Lessons For Retirees
text: The recent market crash is a real crisis for retirees.

title: Great Depression Unemployment Level Would Wipe Out 40 Million US Jobs
text: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported that 701,000 people lost jobs in March.

title: Putin Is Ready To Cut Oil Supply, But Demand Destruction Still Grows
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that, after sending the oil markets into a massive crash a month ago by blowing up the OPEC+ exports limitation agreement, his country is now ready to work with OPEC and other countries to implement far deeper cuts to crude production.

title: OPEC+ meeting delayed as Saudi Arabia and Russia row over price collapse
text: OPEC and Russia have postponed a meeting planned for Monday until later next week, OPEC sources said on Saturday, as a row intensified between Moscow and Saudi Arabia over who is to blame for plunging oil prices.

title: Is the End of Quarter Market Run-Up Just Wall Street Dressing the Window?
text: Stocks rose as the quarter drew to a close, but don't get caught thinking the tide has shifted.

title: How the coronavirus job cuts played out by sector and demographics
text: The job losses suffered in March as the U.S. economy shut down in the face of the novel coronavirus pandemic were widespread but still were disproportionately felt in a handful of employment sectors and by women, the young and the less educated.

title: OPEC and its allies will likely postpone emergency meeting to April 8 or 9, sources say
text: OPEC and its allies will not hold their emergency virtual meeting on Monday and will likely postpone it until April 8 or 9 to allow more time for negotiations, two OPEC sources said on Saturday.
